revised_title: James Dwyer McGee: A Life in Photoelectronics
tldr: James Dwyer McGee was a pioneering figure in the field of photoelectronics, contributing to the development of television in the 1930s and working on astronomical detectors in the 1960s and 1970s. Born in Australia, McGee showed early talent in mathematics and science, attending St Patrick's College and later Sydney University, where he earned a degree in physics. He then pursued research at Cambridge University under the guidance of J. Chadwick. McGee's work in the field of photoelectronics led to significant contributions in television development and astronomical detection technology.
